resources.string: Device Virtualization Engine

DeviceVirtualization Engine (DV Engine for short) is a multi-device virtualization platform provided by Huawei to facilitate the virtualization of external devices and components. Through this platform, peripheral devices or device components are converted into virtual components of mobile phones, and their capabilities are incorporated and utilized by mobile phones as general capabilities. In addition, capabilities of multiple virtual devices can be used synchronously.
Service Introduction
Service Features

string.name: text_provide_user_devicevirtualization
string.b: Distributed device virtualization provides users with the following benefits:

resources.string: \u2022 Resource advantages of various devices are fully leveraged, and the optimal execution hardware is selected for each scenario users encounter. For example, the external cameras are used to provide a wider field of view; the external speakers are used when a broader sound pickup range and superior sound quality are required; the external large-screen display is used to provide clearer images; external fitness and health devices can help obtain heart rate information and provide for more scientifically-grounded health functions.\n\u2022 Services are seamlessly transferred among devices.

string.name: text_provide_developer_devicevirtualization
string.b: Distributed device virtualization provides you developers with the following benefits:

resources.string:
• Higher usage frequency
• Longer usage time
• Greater traffic
• Improved brand recognition
Use Cases

• Entertainment
Video call enhancement: During a video call, the phone, smart TV, speaker, and camera work seamlessly. With the multi-microphone sound pickup capability of the smart speaker, the large display of the smart TV, and the wide angle of the camera, the video call data flow is transferred to external devices, providing an enhanced hands-free video calling experience.
Video sharing: External cameras, such as the drones, can shoot and share videos with a wider horizon.
• Smart travel
Driving safety and convenience: The mobile phone, head unit, and cameras can be collaboratively controlled, virtually pooling the resources of the mobile phone and vehicle.
• Fitness and Health
Scientifically-grounded workouts: The phone, smart TV, camera, speaker, wearable device, and fitness device collaborate for intelligent workouts that harness each device's unique capabilities.
Personal health assistance: The mobile phone and wearable devices work together to collect and analyze the user's health information.

string.name: text_what_permissions_require_appintegration
string.b: What Permissions are Required for Using the SDK?

resources.string:
When the SDK is running, the system permission is not called.
If an app needs to use a virtualized peripheral, corresponding permissions are required.
• Camera permission: Required when the app needs to use the camera.
• Audio permission: Required when the app needs to use the audio related capabilities.
• Distributed permission: Required when the app needs to use external virtual distributed peripherals.

string.name: text_what_data_collect_appintegration
string.b: What Data Does the SDK Collect?

resources.string: The SDK collects the app ID, package name, and API call status of the app to continuously improve DV Engine. The SDK does not collect user data.

Overview

DeviceVirtualization Engine (DV Engine for short) extends devices or components services to supplement the mobile phone through virtualization technology. It enables device vendors to use the capabilities of peripheral devices and components, including but not limited to cameras, speakers, monitors, and microphones. With the distributed device virtualization platform, peripheral devices or components are used to extend the mobile phone capabilities to form a "super device" that delivers an optimal user experience.

resources.string: Data Security

The SDK contains external APIs (aar) and independent app services (APKs). The APIs need to be compiled into the vendor\'s app during the compilation and packaging of the app. The app services are started when the APIs are called. After the app services are started, the virtualization capability is provided in the background. The app services can be stopped at any time by calling the APIs.

string.name: text_what_data_collect_deviceintegration
string.b: What Data Does the SDK Collect?

resources.string: \u2022 Image data is collected through the camera.\n\u2022 Audio data is collected through the microphone.

string.name: text_how_data_protect_deviceintegration
string.b: How Does the SDK Protect Your Data?

resources.string: \u2022 Two-way authentication is required when the device tries to establish a connection with the phone to ensure that the device is trusted.\n\u2022 Data transmitted between devices and phones is encrypted to prevent data leakage.
